name: WP Simple Forms
author: Pat Brown

sections.description: WP Simple Forms is a hybrid between the Custom Contact Forms plugin already on WordPress and Google forms. The backend interface is very similar to the interface you see on Google forms, allowing you to easily create text, multiple choice, check box questions, textareas, and drop down menus. Questions can also be marked as required.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the ‘wp-simple-forms’ folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Create your first form.
  4. Place [simpleform name=”formname”] on a page to insert the form. (formname would be the name of the form)
sections.changelog:
0.1.3

  • Fixed formelements.js script issue

0.1.4

  • Fixed style issues, message box issue
  • Tweaked UI elements

short_description: Adding forms to a webpage has never been easier.  Quickly create dropdowns, checkboxes, multiple choice, and text questions for any page on your site.
description: WP Simple Forms is a hybrid between the Custom Contact Forms plugin already on WordPress and Google forms. The backend interface is very similar to the interface you see on Google forms, allowing you to easily create text, multiple choice, check box questions, textareas, and drop down menus. Questions can also be marked as required.

upgrade_notice.0.1.3: A javascript file was not being loaded correctly. Upgrade to fix issue.
upgrade_notice.0.1.4: Style elements have been fixed. Message box UI tweaks have been made. Message box rendering has been fixed.

screenshots.caption: Choose the question type you would like to add.
Add checkboxes, dropdowns and multiple questions on the fly.
Drag and drop questions to reorder them.
Use shortcode to insert the form into any page.
